disclaimer.heading: Disclaimer and Fair use policy
disclaimer.body1: In accord with our non-profit mission, the information - text, images and everything else present on this site has been researched and gathered from various legitimate sources and is being used purely for informational purposes only.
disclaimer.body2: The objective of this site is to promote malaria awareness through some exciting educational activities and games and was not intended to serve as a replacement for professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. Always seek the advice, diagnosis and/or treatment from qualified doctors for any malaria related help.
disclaimer.body3: If the information provided on this site is incorrect, misleading, invalid or outdated, please notify us on our
disclaimer.sourceHeading: Information was referred from here for use in various stages of the application,

stageComplete.message1: Congratulations! You have succesfully completed the

info_tiles.malaria_def: An intermittent and remittent fever caused by a protozoan parasite that invades the red blood cells. The parasite is transmitted by mosquitoes in many tropical and subtropical regions.
info_tiles.animation: The malaria parasite life cycle involves two hosts. During a blood meal, a malaria-infected female Anopheles mosquito inoculates sporozoites into the human host . Sporozoites infect liver cells and mature into schizonts , which rupture and release merozoites.
info_tiles.do_dont:
Dos
Contaminated water around should be disposed.
Use Mosquito repellent.
Body Should be covered as much as possible

Don'ts
Don't keep unscreened doors and windows open.
Don't play outside in shorts and half/without sleeves clothes
info_tiles.odd_one_out:
Citronella can replel mosquitos.
Malaria is transmitted through mosquito bites.
Malaria is transmitted by a mosquito but parasite causes the disease.
info_tiles.match_meds:
Mefloquine can be used to treat mild or moderate malaria but should not be used to treat severe malaria.
Doxycycline is an antibiotic that fights bacteria in the body
Malarone works by interfering with the growth of parasites in the red blood cells of the human body.
info_tiles.side_effects:
Mefloquine, taken every week, may cause upset stomach, dizziness, nausea, headache,vivd dreams, neuropsychiatric side effects.
Malarone taken once every day, may cause nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, headache, diarrhea.
Doxycycline is an antibiotic which when taken every day, may cause sensitivity to sunlight , and upset stomach.
info_tiles.doctor_info: Consult a doctor before you take any medication. Wrong medication can prove to be fatal.
info_tiles.stop_Breed:
Be always alert about your surroundings. Keep a close check on the probable mosquito breeding places. These may include:
Old-tyres,
open-bottles,
drums,
open-containers etc.
info_tiles.stride_Against:
For a long time, there have been many myths and misconceptions prevalent about prevention. Myths:
Homeopathy medicines work in Malaria.
Garlic helps prevent Malaria.
Yeast Extract helps prevent Malaria.
However, some things like Mosquito spray, Air conditioned surroundings, full sleeved clothes are indeed helpful in preventing Malaria.

instructions.title: How to play?
instructions.ins1: Click on the person to move and reach the objects placed on the board
instructions.ins2: Answer the questions that come up. Goal is to reach finishing point.
